channel.title: Quick math question
channel.description:
Haven't done any Math in about 9 months so I'm out-dated. [IMG]http://img834.imageshack.us/img834/1469/capturefqx.png[/img]
This is for a practice test so there wouldn't be any point of helping me unless you provide an explanation. ty.

item.title: Quick math question
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“Rix_, post:4, topic:382596”]Is the answer 1?

Edit: He probably meant removing (x+8) from the expression so you’re just left with -1/3 - -4/3.[/quote]

No you can’t do that.

Radeon:

iirc the answer was (x+7)/(x+8)^4/3

Yes that is the simplest form, I’ve not done Maths in ages either, but that definitely looks right.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick math question

item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

iirc the answer was (x+7)/(x+8)^4/3

item.title: Quick math question
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

Is the answer 1?

Edit: He probably meant removing (x+8) from the expression so you’re just left with -1/3 - -4/3.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick math question
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“SETO, post:2, topic:382596”][quote author=Radeon link=topic=478390.msg3501498#msg3501498 date=1297767541]
Haven’t done any Math in about 9 months so I’m out-dated.

This is for a practice test so there wouldn’t be any point of helping me unless you provide an explanation. ty.
[/quote]
Take out the common factor which would be the lowest term[/quote]

Well I managed to complete the question before you responded but I didn’t use the method you suggested. I don’t really understand what you mean though and I’m curious as to how else it could be solved. Could you please explain further?

Read full topic

item.title: Quick math question

item.description:

This is for a practice test so there wouldn’t be any point of helping me unless you provide an explanation. ty.[/quote]
